reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Caribbean - Regional Rapid Plant Health Diagnostics

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Under the Greater Caribbean Safeguarding Initiative, the Food Production Department of the University of the West Indies, St. Augustine has committed to providing diagnostic services to this sector throughout the Caribbean. Specifically the operation of a modern laboratory with the ability to send, receive and timely and accurately diagnose plant health issues. APHIS supported this training for laboratory technicians related to laboratory procedures for sample collection, diagnostic techniques, and identificaion tools for plant pests and diseases. Objectives included techniques and protocols to 1) operate, maintain and repair highly complex research instruments/equipment; 2) perform tests, analyze and interpret results of data collected or received from outside agencies and clients; 3) communicate results of testing to internal and external clients; 4) develop and maintain quality control procedures to ensure accuracy of results; and 5) maintain inventory and purchase laboratory supplies..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Trinidad and Tobago is a leading economic force in the Caribbean and critical to regional energy security because of its well-developed oil and gas industry. Despite its relative wealth, Trinidad and Tobago suffers from high crime, underdevelopment, and pockets of significant poverty. U.S. assistance promotes the development of professional military and security forces to strengthen the rule of law, increase accountability and interagency security cooperation, and improve maritime and border security. Programs to advance citizen security through the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative complement and enhance U.S. bilateral assistance.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
